info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...OUTFLOW AHEAD OF A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...SOUTHERN BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...NORTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...WEST CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 740 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm outflow boundary near Ellwood City, or near Beaver Falls, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Weirton, Butler, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, and Aliquippa. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 13 and 51. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 51 and 98. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 81. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio...western, southwestern and west central Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia.
